p: In Al Asbab wa-Alamat, the management of nazla-e-wabaiya is done with anti-inflammatory, immunomodulatory and antipyretic drugs such as decoction of behidana ( Cydonia oblonga Mill., Rosaceae) 3 g, unnab ( Ziziphus jujube Mill., Rhamnaceae) 5 no., sapistan ( Cordia dichotoma G. Forst., Boraginaceae) 9 no., and khaksi ( Sisymbrium adenophorum (Wooton & Standl.) Tidestr., Brassicaceae) 5 g. In case of associated diarrhea, habb-ul aas ( Myrtus communis L., Myrtaceae) and tabasheer ( Bambusa bambos (L.) Voss, Poaceae) are also prescribed. Sheera tukhm e kahu ( Lactuca sativa L., Compositae, seed paste) may be given to relieve thirst. If pneumonia or pleurisy occurs, qairooti aarad karsana (10 g), Aloe vera L. sap (1 g), C. sativus L. stamen (1 g) are crushed, mixed and warmed slightly, then they are applied on the chest wall and covered with a cotton bandage ( Baghdadi, 2004; Samarqandi, 2010).
